articles.description: After four seasons at Northwestern, quarterback Hunter Johnson is transferring back to Clemson -- a rare transfer to Dabo Swinney's program.
articles.headline: Onetime Clemson football recruit QB Hunter Johnson transfers back to Tigers after career at Northwestern

article.description: There was a special feeling when Harvard kicked off its season Saturday because coach Tim Murphy opened his 25th year leading the Ivy League power.
article.headline: Shampklin carries Harvard past Toreros
article.story: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- Aaron Shampklin rushed for 178 yards and four touchdowns and Harvard opened its 145th season with a 36-14 victory over San Diego on Saturday. Shampklin ran for three of his touchdowns in the first quarter, including a career-long 64-yarder for the sophomore, when the Crimson took a 27-3 lead in their highest-scoring quarter since 2013. Shampklin's four rushing TDs were one short of the school record set in 1951 by Tom Ossman. Devin Darrington added 98 yards rushing and a score. Justice Shelton-Mosley had 127 yards receiving -- Harvard's first 100-yard receiving game since 2016 -- on seven catches. Jake Smith threw for 195 yards on 13-of-21 passing as the Crimson outgained San Diego 461-391, including 266-93 on the ground. Michael Bandy caught 12 passes for 202 yards -- both career-highs -- for the Toreros (1-1). Anthony Lawrence was 23-of-46 passing for 298 yards with an interception.
